title: ISSS608-Website
text:
Welcome to ISSS609 Visual Analytics and Applications homepage.
In this website, you will find my coursework prepared for this course.
Fun fact: Cats are cute

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they willl be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they willl be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Plotting Bar Chart of Science score Distribution
text:
Plotting Bar Chart of Science score Distribution

ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = SCIENCE)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=10, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="Yellow", 
                 fill="Blue") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Science scores")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Plotting a Box Plot of the English scores of the different races
text:
Plotting a Box Plot of the English scores of the different races

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = ENGLISH, 
           x= RACE)) +
  geom_boxplot()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Plotting a Scatter Plot of the Science vs Math scores
text:
Plotting a Scatter Plot of the Science vs Math scores

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= SCIENCE, y=MATHS)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(size=0.5)

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.


`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Plotting a Line graph of the scores of the different classes
text: Plotting a Line graph of the scores of the different classes

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Plotting a Violin Plot of science scores in the different classes
text:
Plotting a Violin Plot of science scores in the different classes

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = SCIENCE, 
           x= CLASS)) +
  geom_violin()
